department_name: Stanislaus County Department of Environmental Resources - Environmental Health

grading_system.description: Grading system methodology not found in official sources. Inspections are documented with violation reports but no specific letter grades, numerical scores, or pass/fail thresholds were identified.

inspection_details.frequency: The majority of the 2,400 permitted food service establishments receive two unannounced routine food safety inspections per year
inspection_details.reinspection_trigger: Facilities with three or more violations or major violations are subject to reinspection
inspection_details.public_disclosure: All inspections are posted online at secure.stancounty.com/FoodFacilities/ with inspection notices from past three years available. Facilities must keep most recent inspection report on-site for public viewing upon request.

fire_safety_authority.ansul_system_requirements: Commercial kitchen hood fire protection systems require separate plan submittals to Fire Prevention Bureau. NFPA 96 standards require semi-annual inspections every six months by licensed fire protection companies.
fire_safety_authority.inspection_frequency: Semi-annual (every 6 months) for commercial kitchen hood fire suppression systems

regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County level inspections conducted by Stanislaus County Department of Environmental Resources
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: Stanislaus County does not allow Micro Enterprise Home Kitchen operations (AB 626) - foods cannot be cooked at home unless specifically listed in approved categories

confidence_notes: Official department information found, regulatory framework confirmed, fire safety requirements identified. However, specific grading system methodology could not be verified from publicly available sources.
verification_notes: Need to verify specific grading methodology if any exists beyond violation-based reporting. Should confirm inspection frequency for different risk categories and detailed fire safety inspection requirements for commercial kitchens.
